Groups.Group: Red Hat Software Collections 1 for RHEL 6
Red Hat Software Collections 1 for RHEL 7

Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk nodejs010
exit 0

isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk nodejs010-nodejs-has-flag

isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk nodejs010-nodejs-is-glob

Vulnerability.Title: nodejs010 bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description:
Updated nodejs010 packages that fix two bugs and add one enhancement are now available for Red Hat Software Collections. Node.js is a software development platform for building fast and scalable network applications in the JavaScript programming language.
This update fixes the following bugs:
* Previously, the symbolic link pointing to the inherits@2 directory was broken. Consequently, certain packages dependent on inherits had incorrect dependencies. With this update, all symlinks point directly to the inherits directory, and inherits@2 has been removed from the file system. This is possible because inherits in version 1.* were never shipped, so it is not necessary to use symlinks to point to inherits@2. As a result, all packages have correct dependencies. (BZ#1268882)
* The broken symbolic link pointing to the inherits@2 directory also caused that the npm package manager was unable to traverse all modules installed globally. Consequently, using the "npm ls -g" command to list global packages details failed with an error message. With this update, the symlink logic for inherits@2 has been disabled, and "npm ls -g" now works as expected. Note that packages other than npm are unaffected. (BZ#1271290)
In addition, this update adds the following enhancement:
* The nodejs010-nodejs-nodemon package and related packages have been added to the nodejs010 Software Collection. The nodemon utility monitors files in the directory in which nodemon was started and if any file changes, nodemon automatically restarts the appropriate Node.js application. (BZ#1291389)
Users of nodejs010 are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add this enhancement.
Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
